alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued April 19 at 2:55AM EDT until April 19 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON EDT TODAY THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Splash-over and beach erosion due to high astronomical tides, storm surge, and building nearshore waves. * WHERE...Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Hampton Harbor NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.0 ft, Moderate 12.0 ft, Major 13.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 19/02 AM 10.3 0.8 0.4 3-6 None 19/02 PM 9.6 0.1 0.6 7-9 None 20/02 AM 9.8 0.3 -0.2 7 None 20/03 PM 7.9 -1.6 -0.8 5 None 21/03 AM 9.2 -0.3 -0.6 3-4 None 21/04 PM 8.1 -1.4 -0.3 3-4 None Seavey Island / Portsmouth NH MLLW Categories - Minor 11.5 ft, Moderate 12.5 ft, Major 13.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.7 ft, Moderate 3.7 ft, Major 4.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 19/02 AM 10.0 1.2 0.3 3-6 None 19/02 PM 9.4 0.6 0.7 8-10 None 20/02 AM 9.6 0.8 -0.2 7-8 None 20/03 PM 7.7 -1.1 -0.8 5-6 None 21/03 AM 9.0 0.2 -0.6 3-4 None 21/04 PM 7.9 -0.9 -0.2 3-4 None &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
